borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The combination of the proposed first floor extension with the approved ground floor side and rear extensions represent the overdevelopment of the plot, significantly altering what can be expected for this size and shape of plot which is unacceptable and would result in the built form of the terrace and the original dwelling to be lost. The partial loss of gap between the host dwelling and the </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">neighboring</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;dwelling would be visible in both the short views within the street scene and the wider views within the banjo cul-de-sac, facing towards Wren Road. The proposed addition would be unsympathetic and uncharacteristic to the original dwelling house, the terrace and the wider Becontree Estate,&nbsp;significantly altering the scale and massing of the original dwelling and terrace within the street scene. The proposed additional bedroom would increase the reliance on a&nbsp;suitably sized private garden which is not provided by the application site. As such the proposed development is&nbsp; unacceptable and contrary to:</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)</span><br><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of The London Plan </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">(March 2016)</span><br><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies HC1, D1 and D4 of the&nbsp;Draft London Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">(December 2019)</span><br><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">(July 2010)</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">, </span><br><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies BP2, BP5 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">(March 2011)</span><br><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies SPP6, SP2, DMD1, DMD6 and DMD4 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, June 2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span arial="">The&nbsp;proposed development will&nbsp;result&nbsp;in an unacceptable impact on the living conditions of the neighbouring property No. 5 Wren Gardens with regard to an unacceptable loss of daylight, increased sense of overbearing and enclosure and causing unacceptable overshadowing. Therefore the development is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework Borough Wide Development Plan (March 2011)<br>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;(Regulation 19 Consultation version, June 2020)<br>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012).</span><br></p>
description: CONSTRUCTION OF FIRST FLOOR SIDE EXTENSION
